summary: We reviewed how 23 civilian federal agencies implemented the Federal Information Security Modernization Act of 2014. Results were mixed in whether and how agencies implemented required security programs. For example, most reported meeting goals for detecting and preventing incidents. However, inspectors general found that only 7 of 23 agencies had effective security programs in FY 2020. We also found that the guidance provided for inspectors...
title: Cybersecurity: OMB Should Update Inspector General Reporting Guidance to Increase Rating Consistency and Precision
